content: Mani Srivastava â€“ Samueli Electrical and Computer Engineering Skip to Main Content Mani Srivastava Professor Primary Area: Circuits & Systems, Signals & Systems Office:	6730E Boelter Hall Phone:	(310) 267-2098 E-mail:	mbs@ee.ucla.edu Research Lab:	Networked and Embedded Systems Laboratory Research and Teaching Interests: Embedded software, ubiquitous and mobile computing, human-cyber-physical systems, security and privacy, mobile health, internet of things, energy-aware computing Awards and Recognitions 2017 ACM Fellow 2017 ACM/IEEE IPSN, Best Demonstration Paper Award 2016 ACM BuildSys, Audience Choice Award 2016 ACM UbiComp, Honorable Mention Award 2015 ACM MobiCom, Best Paper Award 2015 ACM MobiCom, Best Community Paper Award 2014 IEEE Percom, Best Runner-up Paper Award 2010 IEEE Real-Time Systems Symposium (RTSS), Best Paper Award 2010 ACM Workshop on Hot Topics in Embedded Networked Sensors (HotEmNets), Best Paper Award 2010 ACM/IEEE International Conference on Information Processing in Sensor Networks (IPSN), Best Paper Award 2009 ACM International Workshop on UnderWater Networks (WUWNet), Best Paper Award 2009 International Symposium on Location and Context Awareness, Best Paper Award 2008 IEEE Fellow 2008 ACM SenSys, Best Paper Award 2008 IEEE ISSCC & ACM/IEEE DAC, Design Competition Award (Systems Category) 2006 IEEE/ACM ISLPED, Best Paper Nomination 2005 IEEE/ACM ISLPED, Design Contest Award 2002 ACM/IEEE Design Automation Conference, Design Contest Award (Operational Category) 1998 Okawa Foundation Grant Award 1997 IEEE Int. Conf. Distributed Computing Systems, Best Paper Award 1997 National Science Foundation CAREER Award 1995 IEEE/ACM Design Automation Conference, Best Paper Nomination 1991 VHDL Users Group Conference, Best Paper Nomination
